lines.text: [while posing Doris with her champion dog and his numerous awards, the photographer hikes the lady's skirt to show her shapely legs]
There! That's great!
[Doris rearranges her skirt to cover her legs]
Sorry, boys, but these are not trophies.
What do you think of the suicide theory now, Sergeant?
Well, it's slightly complicated since the man shot, slugged and stabbed himself - especially in the back.

[Refering to the wounded Sir Thomas]
Could the wound have been self-inflicted, doctor?
I'm the city butcher, not a detective. Don't bother me with any murders after three tomorrow. I'm going to the World Series.
Sergeant, here's your order for removal of the body.
Thanks, Doc.
So long. I want food.
Well, nobody's stoppin' yuh.
And if you got any more corpses, bring 'em out now, will yuh? I can't be running up and down here all day!
Watta yuh mean running up and down all day with that swell car the city gave yuh?

[With frustration as he leaves]
Ugh!

[as the doctor's leaving]
Nothing upsets the doctor clearly.

[Frustrated, after being called for the third time]
I'd like to rent a room here until they finish this case.
Say, Markham, I just heard about Arthur Coe.
Yes. Too bad he had to bump himself off like that.
Hmm, that's why I called you. You sure that he did bump himself off?
Well, his butler tells us he's sitting in a locked room with a revolver in his hand and a bullet in his head. I don't know what else you'd call it.
Well, if you knew Archer Coe, you would know that suicide would be almost a psychological impossibility for him.
Psychological, bosh! Now two and two make four, don't they?
How do you know you have two and two?
Haven't you got any ideas, Vance?
Markham, it's a maze of conflicting clues. Any one of seven people might have done it.
We couldn't convict seven people, Mr. Vance.
You couldn't convict one with the evidence you've got.
I'm a doctor, not a magician.
I'm a doctor, not a detective.

[Walking into the Coe study filled with Chinese antiques]
What is this - a bedroom or a museum? More junk here than a Chinese josh house!
"Unsolved Murders!" That's a swell book to take to Chicago!

[Referring to the corpse]
He's been dead for four hours.

[Sarcastically]
And me thinkin' he's playin' possum.
Well, there are too many people in the world anyway!

[after a frustrating develpment]
Well, Mr. Vance, where are we now?
I should say somewhere in the middle of the Gobi Desert.

[to Vance]
I've got it! The Chinese cook! They're always full of those tricks.

[Referring to the corpse]
There couldn't have been much of a struggle. His hair isn't even mussed.
Maybe somebody slugged him and then combed his hair.
